The External Command view displays relevant information when running user-specified external commands.

To run an external command, select Tools > External Tools.
To add an external command, go to Tools > Preferences. On the Tools Menu tab, add one command per line.
Contextual help is not supported on this OS.

message.entry: Reload results to show freshly computed defects and coding rule violations
A result is already open, do you want to open the new result?
The analysis is completed, do you want to reload the results?
Enable the New Desktop for Polyspace. You must restart Polyspace for changes to take effect.

Polyspace Platform is an integrated environment that supports static analysis and dynamic testing of C/C++ code with Polyspace products.
Polyspace Platform will replace the current desktop user interface in a future release.

New Features
Benefits of Polyspace Platform include:
  • Single platform - Run all Polyspace products, including Polyspace Test, in one common interface.
  • Custom coding rules - Create your own coding rules and coding standards.
  • Justifying identical findings - Save time reviewing results by justifying identical findings simultaneously.
  • Enhanced dashboards - Determine at a glance how many findings have been reviewed or remain to be reviewed.
For more details, see Benefits and Limitations of Switching to Polyspace Platform User Interface
An unexpected error occurred while loading the results:

Do you want to save the justifications {0} {1}
WARNING: Number of findings to export ({0}) exceeds the maximum number of findings ({1}) that Polyspace can export to specified file format.

If number of findings exceeds upper limit for results export, Polyspace filters out excess results in this order:1. Code Metrics; 2. Low impact defects (Bug Finder) or green checks (Code Prover). If number of findings still exceeds upper limit, Polyspace keeps only the first {0} findings.

Try the following to generate a manageable number of findings for review: Disable Code Metrics and use Guideline checks instead for metrics of interest; Enable only High Impact Defects in a Bug Finder analysis; Customize the set of Coding Standard rules that you want to enforce in your code. After you address this first set of findings, enable additional checks as needed.

Warning: no write permission in the project folder {0}.\nDefaulting to Temp folder {1}.
Console formats are only available for "Polyspace as You Code" results.
Option {0} is required when {1} is used.
The following value is given without an option name: {0}.
A value is required for option {0}.
Unexpected value given for option {0}.\nSupported values are: {1}.
Option {0} must be followed by an integer value.
The -api-key option can not be used with the -login/-encrypted-password options.
The -credentials-file option can not be used with -login/-encrypted-password/api-key options.

NAME {0}
SYNOPSIS {0} -format <{1}> <OPTIONS>
DESCRIPTION Use {0} to export Polyspace results stored locally or in the Polyspace Access web interface.
OPTIONS General options -format <{1}> Format of exported result list.
-output-name <OUTPUT_NAME> File name of generated results list or folder name. The command stores OUTPUT_NAME on the path from which you call the command. To store the generated files in a different folder, specify the full path of the folder. This option is not compatible with the console format.
-set-language-english Export results in English. Use this option if your display language is set to another language.
-key-mode <file-scope|function-scope> Generate the location key using either the line number in the file or the line offset from the start of the containing function. Default value is file.
-help Display this help
Local results options -results-dir <FOLDER> Results folder to export data from. By default, the command generates reports for results in the current folder. This option is not compatible with Polyspace Access results.
Polyspace Access options -host <HOSTNAME> Fully qualified host name of the machine hosting the Polyspace Access web interface. This option is required only when you export results stored in Polyspace Access.
-run-id <RUN_ID> Run ID of the analysis results stored in Polyspace Access. Polyspace assigns a unique run ID to each analysis run you upload to Polyspace Access. To get the run ID of analysis results, see polyspace-access -h. This option is required only when you generate reports for results stored in Polyspace Access.
-login <USERNAME> Username you use to log in to Polyspace Access
-encrypted-password <ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD> Use polyspace-access -encrypt-password to generate an encrypted password using your Polyspace Access login credentials. See polyspace-access -h.
-credentials-file <FILE> Path to text file where you list your Polyspace Access login credentials. File must contain either the -login and -encrypted-password options on separate lines, or the -api-key option. Restrict read permissions on this file to increase security.
-api-key arg The API Key used to log into Polyspace Access. Not compatible with -login and -encrypted-password.
-port <PORT_NUMBER> Port number of the server hosting the Polyspace Access web interface. Default value is 9443.
-protocol <http|https> HTTP protocol used for Polyspace Access. Default value is https.
